intro: Thesium glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered thesium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thesium glomeratum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
